level.text: The party initiating the case may move to dismiss the case at any time, and the Administrative Law Judge may grant the motion without waiting for a response from the opposing side.
An opposing party who objects to the voluntary dismissal of a case may file a motion for reconsideration as provided in Subsection 2828.
The parties may file a joint motion for dismissal of a case with or without prejudice.
Dismissal under this Section shall be without prejudice, unless an Administrative Law Judge orders otherwise. A dismissal with prejudice may occur:
If the party requesting dismissal has previously dismissed the claim;
If the motion for dismissal is made pursuant to a settlement that does not specifically require dismissal without prejudice; or
In order to prevent harm to the other side.
